feed.title: Fantasy11Team.com
feed.subtitle: Platform to help build a better dream team

entry.title: Welcome to Fantasy11team.com
entry.content:
Hey! Welcome to Fantasy11test.com, it’s great to have you :)

We will be providing you great tips, previews and suggestions and lastest news which help you in building a great team. Good Luck!!

There are a few things that we will be provising on this site:

  1. News about the teams, who is in the squad, who is not playing the match, who is replacing who.
  2. Expected 11 from both the teams will be provided along with suggestions about captain and vice-captain.
  3. Our dream teams will also be published to help you out in the selection.

This website has been developed using jasper2 from the github.
entry.summary: Hey! Welcome to Fantasy11test.com, it’s great to have you :)

entry.title: Guide For Buying The Best Laptop

link.title: Guide For Buying The Best Laptop

entry.content:
Let’s get started!!

You want to buy a laptop but you don’t know how to decide which laptop you should buy, what are the configurations, what are tech factor which determines a good laptop. Don’t worry. We are here to help you out.

We will list down the major attributes you should be looking before you decide on buying a laptop.

Brand

This is one of the main factors as you don’t want to buy a laptop from a company which doesn’t care about you once you have bought their device. Go for a company which provides good customer care service and also which can deliver the service to your home as well. We will list down major players in this area which can narrow down your search a little bit.

  • HP
  • Dell
  • Lenovo
  • Acer
  • Asus
  • Apple
  • Microsoft
Screen Size

Laptop comes with different screen sizes which are measured diagonally. Screen size determines the whole size of the laptop. Some people like big screens while others like it not bulky. Depending on the choice you can select one of the screen sizes listed below. In our opinion 14 inch screen laptop is the most apt laptop.

  • 15.6’
  • 14.0’
  • 13.3’
  • 12.0’
  • 11.6’
  • 10.1’
Processor

Processor is the main component of computer system which determines the processing speed and capabilities of the system. There are many manufacturers of processor among which Intel is the prominent brand. 99% laptops come with Intel processors in them. As of now, Intel has developed many processors with many generations. We will list out the Intel Processors which you should look for while selecting a laptop.

  • Intel i7 7th Generation
  • Intel i7 6th Generation
  • Intel i7 5th Generation
  • Intel i5 7th Generation
  • Intel i5 6th Generation
  • Intel i5 5th Generation
Primary Storage(RAM)

Primary storage, also known as RAM is the second component on which your system’s speed is dependent. The latest technology in RAM in DDR4. Others are DDR3 and DDR2. DDR2 is very old now so you can go with DDR3 or DDR4. RAM also comes in different sizes like 4GB,6GB and 8GB. Just remember, once you buy a laptop, you can not increase its RAM unlike Desktops.

Secondary Storage

Secondary storage is required to store your documents, files, movies, audios. As of now there are 2 versions of secondary storage. Selecting SDD over HDD will highly impact the price of laptop.

  1. HDD : Most of the laptops comes with HDD storage and comes in different capacities like 512GB and 1TB(1024GB). This storage is cheap as compared to SDD but it is little slower.
  2. SDD : SDD storage is fast but it is very costly.
Operating System

When you buy a laptop, you get 2 options. Either you can buy a laptop with already installed Operating System(OS) on it(In most of the cases Windows is already installed and laptop price is including the Operating System) OR you can choose a laptop without OS(means with DOS installed) and install it later. In Second option, your laptop price will be lower as compared to the first option.

Additional Things
  1. LAN Port: If you don’t have wireless network at your home and you directly have connection from your internet provider, then you need this port in your laptop so that you can directly connect the wire to you laptop.
  2. USB Port: Check the number of ports and if they are USB 3.0 or USB 2.0. USB 3.0 is faster in transferring data as compared to 2.0.
  3. Keyboard Quality: Check the keyboard quality before making the purchase.
  4. Graphic Card: If you are looking for a laptop for heavy gaming then you should check the laptops with graphic card of 1GB/2GB/4GB(from Nvidia or AMD).

We hope this guide has given you some insight in selecting a laptop. Let us know if you want any help in finding a suitable laptop for you. Just comment in the bloe section and we will get back to you.

entry.title: IN vs SA First ODI, Today’s Match, Dream Team, Prediction

link.title: IN vs SA First ODI, Today's Match, Dream Team, Prediction

entry.content:
Hello and Welcome to the first ODI match preview of 6 ODI match series between India and South Africa.

India has played 7 ODIs on this ground with 6 loss and 1 no result. While South Africa scored above 300 in 50-over format with centuries from Faf du Plesis and David Miller. India has already lost the test series to South Africa by 2-1. But India’s win in the last test match have given a lot of confidence to the guests.

While hosts will be looking to continue their dominance as ODI top team, India will also be using this series to be the number 1 ODI team in the World.

We will be providing match predictions, probable XI, tips and some tricks to help you win big in this match.

Important

AB de Villiers will not be playing first three ODI matches agains India due to injury. Khaya Zondo is expected to make his debut.

Event Details

Indis vs South Africa ODI Series IN vs SA

  • Kingsmead, Durban
  • Date: Feb 1, 04:30 PM IST
Venue ODI Stats
  • Total matches 43
  • Matches won batting first 21
  • Matches won bowling first 16
  • Average 1st Inns scores 237
  • Average 2nd Inns scores 183
Squads

India: Virat Kohli (capt), Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, Yuzvendra Chahal, Shikhar Dhawan, MS Dhoni (wk), Shreyas Iyer, Kedar Jadhav, Dinesh Karthik, Kuldeep Yadav, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mohammed Shami, Manish Pandey, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, Ajinkya Rahane, Shardul Thakur.

South Africa: Faf du Plessis (capt), Hashim Amla, Quinton de Kock (wk), JP Duminy, Imran Tahir, Aiden Markram, David Miller, Morne Morkel, Chris Morris, Lungi Ngidi, Andile Phehlukwayo, Kagiso Rabada, Tabraiz Shamsi, Khaya Zondo.

Key Players

India: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, M Shami

South Africa: Q De Kock, Faf du Plessis, Rabada

ST-W vs PS-W Probable Playing XI :

India: Virat Kohli (capt), Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, Yuzvendra Chahal, Shikhar Dhawan, MS Dhoni (wk), Kedar Jadhav, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mohammed Shami, Manish Pandey, Hardik Pandya.

South Africa: Faf du Plessis (capt), Hashim Amla, Quinton de Kock (wk), JP Duminy, Imran Tahir, David Miller, Morne Morkel, Chris Morris, Lungi Ngidi, Andile Phehlukwayo, Kagiso Rabada.

Dream Team

Suggestions
  • Q de Kock plays very good against India. In our Opinio, Kock should be taken.
  • In Batsmens du Plessis, Amla, Rohit and Kohli.
  • Morris, Duminy and Hardik are option in all rounders.
  • In bowlers Rabada, Ngidi and Bumrah.
  • If you want you can change Captain and Vc as you like.

Let us know your favourite team and your favourite players.
entry.summary: Hello and Welcome to the first ODI match preview of 6 ODI match series between India and South Africa.

entry.title: PS-W vs ST-W Aus Women T20 Bash WBBL 2017-18 1st Semi Final, Today’s Match, Dream Team, Prediction

link.title: PS-W vs ST-W Aus Women T20 Bash WBBL 2017-18 1st Semi Final, Today's Match, Dream Team, Prediction

entry.content:
Welcome to the 1st Semi Final of Australia Women Big Bash 2017-18 between Sydney Thunders and Perth Scorchers. This is third season of WBBL where ST is going to lock horn with PS in the semi final match

We will be providing match predictions, probable XI, tips and some tricks to help you win big in this match.

Important

The road to finals (most recent last):

  • Sydney Thunder:WLWWWWWLWWLWLW
  • Perth Scorchers: WWLWLWLWLLWWLW
  • Overall head to head: Thunder 5, Scorchers 2
Point Table
Teams Mat Won Lost Tied
Sydney Sixers Women 14 10 4 0
Sydney Thunder Women 14 10 4 0
Perth Scorchers Women 14 8 6 0
Adelaide Strikers Women 14 8 6 0
Brisbane Heat Women 14 7 7 0
Melbourne Renegades Women 14 6 8 0
Melbourne Stars Women 14 5 9 0
Hobart Hurricanes Women 14 2 12 0
Event Details

Australia Women Big Bash 2017-18 PS-W vs ST-W

  • Perth Stadium(Optus Stadium), Perth
  • Date: Feb 1, 09:40 AM IST
Squads

Sydney Thunders: Alex Blackwell (C), Sam Bates, Nicola Carey, Rene Farrell, Maisy Gibson, Lisa Griffith, Rachael Haynes, Rachel Priest, Naomi Stalenberg, Stafanie Taylor, Rachel Trenaman, Belinda Vakarewa, Fran Wilson

Perth Scorchers: Elyse Villani (C), Megan Banting, Nicole Bolton, Katherine Brunt, Piepa Cleary, Lauren Ebsary, Heather Graham, Emma King, Thamsyn Newton, Taneale Peschel, Chloe Piparo, Natalie Sciver, Emily Smith

Key Players

Sydney Thunders: Rachael Haynes, Rene Farrell, Rachel Priest, Alex Blackwell, S Taylor, N Carey, Rene Farrell

Perth Scorchers: Katherine Brunt, Nicole Bolton, Elyse Villani, K Brunt, N Sciver, H Graham

ST-W vs PS-W Probable Playing XI :

Sydney Thunders: Stafanie Taylor, Rachael Haynes, Alex Blackwell (c), Rachel Priest (wk), Rene Farrell, Fran Wilson, Nicola Carey, Belinda Vakarewa, Maisy Gibson, Samantha Bates, Lisa Griffith

Perth Scorchers: Elyse Villani (c), Katherine Brunt, Natalie Sciver, Nicole Bolton, Thamsyn Newton, Megan Banting, Piepa Cleary, Lauren Ebsary, Heather Graham, Emma King, Emily Smith (wk)

Dream Team

Suggestions
  • R Priest is the only option as wicket keeper.
  • In Batsmens N Bolton, E Villani, R Haynes, A Blackwell and N Stalenberg are good.
  • K Brunt, N Sciver, N Carey, S Taylor and H Graham are good all-rounders.
  • In bowlers R Farrell, S Bates, P Cleary, E King, B Vakarewa and T Newton are good choice.
  • If you want you can change Captain and Vc as you like.

Let us know your favourite team and your favourite players.
entry.summary: Welcome to the 1st Semi Final of Australia Women Big Bash 2017-18 between Sydney Thunders and Perth Scorchers. This is third season of WBBL where ST is going to lock horn with PS in the semi final match

entry.title: AF-Y vs PK-Y Under 19 ICC 3rd Place Playoff, Today’s Match, Dream Team, Prediction

link.title: AF-Y vs PK-Y Under 19 ICC 3rd Place Playoff, Today's Match, Dream Team, Prediction

entry.content:
Welcome to the 3rd place playoff of 2018 Under 19 ICC Cricket World Cup between Afghanistan and Pakistan. Both the teams have lost their respective semi-finals of the tournament and now looking for the 3rd place.

Afghanistan will be facing the Pakistan for the 2nd time in the tournament and will be aiming for the second victort over Pakistan. Afghanistan has been a secret superstar in this season as they have lost only match. Pakistan started the season with a loss but picked up very quickly and reached the semi-final.

We will be providing match predictions, probable XI, tips and some tricks to help you win big in this match. Heavy rain showers are expected through the course of the day.

Event Details

ICC Under 19 World Cup AF-Y vs PK-y

  • Queenstown Events Centre, Queenstown
  • Date: Jan30, 3:00 AM IST
Venue ODI Stats
  • Total matches 9
  • Matches won batting first 1
  • Matches won bowling first 6
  • Average 1st Inns scores 164
  • Average 2nd Inns scores 168
Squads
Afghanistan U19:

Naveen-ul-Haq (c), Qais Ahmad, Azmatullah Omarzai, Ikram Ali Khil (wk), Rahmanullah, Mohammad Ibrahim, Zahir Khan, Darwish Rasooli, Baheer Shah, Tariq Stanikzai, Nisar Wahdat, Wafadar, Waqarullah Ishaq, Mujeeb Zadran, Yousuf Zazai

Pakistan U19:

Muhammad Zaid Alam, Imran Shah, Rohail Nazir (wk), Ali Zaryab, Mohammad Taha, Ammad Alam, Saad Khan, Hasan Khan (c), Muhammad Musa, Shaheen Afridi, Arshad Iqbal, Suleman Shafqat, Mohammad Ali Khan, Munir Riaz, Muhammad Mohsin Khan

Key Players
Afghanistan U19:
  • Ikram Ali Khil
  • Rahmanullah
  • Mujeeb Zadran
  • Qasi Ahmed
  • Ibrahim Zadran
Pakistan U19:
  • Muhammad Musa
  • Arshad Iqbal
  • Hasan Khan
  • Shaheen Afridi
  • Ali Zaryab
Afg-Y vs Pak-Y Probable Playing XI :
Afghanistan U19:

Zahir Khan, Ikram Ali Khil (wk), Naveen-ul-Haq (c), Darwish Rasooli, Mujeeb Zadran, Nisar Wahdat, Qais Ahmad, Ibrahim Zadran, Rahmanullah, Azmatullah, Baheer Shah

Pakistan U19:

Hasan Khan (c), Muhammad Musa, Muhammad Zaid Alam, Saad Khan, Shaheen Afridi, Rohail Nazir (wk), Mohammad Taha, Ali Zaryab , Ammad Alam, Arshad Iqbal, Imran Shah

Dream Teams

Suggestions
  • Both the wicket keepers are good. You can choose either one.
  • Ibrahim Zadran, Ali Zaryab, Darwish Rasooli and Rahmanullah are good choice in batting.
  • Azmatullah and Hasan Khan are all rounder selections.
  • Shaheen, Musa, Qasi and Mujeeb are the bset bowlers.

Let us know your favourite team and your favourite players.
entry.summary: Welcome to the 3rd place playoff of 2018 Under 19 ICC Cricket World Cup between Afghanistan and Pakistan. Both the teams have lost their respective semi-finals of the tournament and now looking for the 3rd place.

entry.title: Cape Cobra vs Dolphins 2nd Semi-Final Momentum Cup Dream11 Fantasy11 Preview

link.title: Cape Cobra vs Dolphins 2nd Semi-Final Momentum Cup Dream11 Fantasy11 Preview

entry.content:
Welcome to the 2nd semi-final of Momentum One Day Cup 2017-18. This ground is high scoring ground. We will be providing match predictions, probable XI, tips and some tricks to help you win big in this match.

Both the teams are meeting head to head for the 3rd time in this tournament. Dolphins had won both of them leaving Cobra team thirsty for a win. Cape Cobras will be aiming to end the stranglehold the Dolphins have held over them this season when they meet in the second Momentum One-Day Cup semi-final at PPC Newlands in Cape Town today.

Event Details

Momentum One Day Cup 2017-18 Cape Cobra vs Dolphins

  • Newlands, Cape Town
  • Date: Jan 31, 5:00 PM IST
Venue ODI Stats
  • Total matches 39
  • Matches won batting first 21
  • Matches won bowling first 23
  • Average 1st Inns scores 332
  • Average 2nd Inns scores 296
Squads
Cobras:

Rory Kleinveldt (c), Dayyaan Galiem, Zubayr Hamza, Simon Khomari, George Linde, Pieter Malan, Aviwe Mgijima, Tshepo Moreki, Mthiwekhaya Nabe, Dane Piedt, Dane Paterson, Vernon Philander, Jason Smith, Kyle Verreynne.

Dolphins:

Kehsav Maharaj (c), Sarel Erwee, Senuran Muthusamy, Sibonelo Makhanya, Calvin Savage, Robert Frylinck, Athi Maposa, Zack Paruk, Prenelan Subrayen, Morne van Wyk, Dane Vilas, Smangaliso Nhlebela, Mthokozisi Shezi, Vaughn van Jaarsveld.

Team News

Dumny and Zondo will not be playin this match. Rory Kleinveldt and Keshav Maharaj will be captains instead.

Key Players
Cobras:
  • Pieter Malan
  • Dane Paterson
  • Mthiwekhaya Nabe
Dolphins:
  • Dane Vilas
  • Senuran Muthusamy
  • Keshav Maharaj
Cobras vs Dolphins Probable Playing XI :
Cobras:

Rory Kleinveldt(c), Dayyaan Galiem, Dane Paterson, Aviwe Mgijima, George Linde, Simon Khomari, Zubayr Hamza, Kyle Verreynne (wk), Pieter Malan, Mthiwekhaya Nabe, Jason Smith

Dolphins:

Morne van Wyk, Vaughn van Jaarsveld, Dane Vilas (wk), Prenelan Subrayen, Keshav Maharaj(c), Mthokozisi Shezi, Sarel Erwee, Senuran Muthusamy, Robbie Frylinck, Athi Mpendulo Maposa, Sibonelo Makhanya

Dream Teams

Suggestions
  • Dane Vilas is hte only good choice as wicket keeper.
  • Pieter Malan, Morne van Wyk , Sarel Erwee are good choices.
  • There is obvious choice in all rounders section - JSenuran Muthusamy and George Linde.
  • Dane Paterson, Prenelan Subrayen and Rory Kleinveldt can be selected as bowlers.

Let us know your favourite team and your favourite players. You can contact us for any suggestion or query.

entry.title: SA-Y vs BAN-Y Under19 5th Place Playoff Dream 11 Fantasy 11 Dream Team Preview

link.title: SA-Y vs BAN-Y Under19 5th Place Playoff Dream 11 Fantasy 11 Dream Team Preview

entry.content:
Welcome to the 5th place playoff of ICC Under19 Cricket World Cup. The match will be played between South Africa and Bangladesh. Both the team are already out of the tournament and are fighting for the 5th place in the table. Both the teams have won their last match so there might not be any change in the playing XI.

Bangladesh was on second number in the group D and South Africa also placed itself at no. 2 in the Group A. Both the team posses good bowling attack however South Africa is strong on batting front end as well. We will be providing you details about the probable 11, Dream 11 team, best fantasy team and the strong players from each squad.

Event Details

Under19 ICC Cricket World Cup 2018 South Africa vs Bangladesh

  • Queenstown Events Centre, Queenstown
  • Date: Jan 31, 3:00 AM IST

  • Matches won batting first 1

Pinak Ghosh, Saif Hassan(c), Aminul Islam, Towhid Hridoy, Afif Hossain, Mohammad Rakib, Shakil Hossain(w), Qazi Onik, Robiul Haque, Hasan Mahmud, Tipu Sultan
